CIserver

Class Responder

  • java.lang.Object
    • CIserver.Responder

  • public class Responder
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Responder implements the functionality to give a sufficient answer to the results of the test throughout commit statuses and mail notifications.

      Responder()

    • Method Detail

      • git_status

        public static int git_status(java.lang.String url_string,
                             java.lang.String sha_string,
                             java.lang.String[] request_params)
        git_status does a HTTP POST request to the given URL and includes the specified data in the JSON format as a payload
        Parameters:
        url_string - the URL of the status to be set
        sha_string - the sha sum of the commit to be set
        request_params - the parameters in string form as requested by doJSON
        Returns:
        0 if the request was successful, otherwise 1

      • create_json

        public static org.json.JSONObject create_json(java.lang.String[] request_params)
        create_json converts an array of strings into the JSON format required by github
        Parameters:
        request_params - an array with the arguments in form of strings in the following order: state, target_url, description, context
        Returns:
        the json object containing the information

      • send

        public static int send(java.lang.String to,
                       java.lang.String subject,
                       java.lang.String text)
        Sends an e-mail from our mailbot.
        Parameters:
        to - - E-mail address of recipient.
        subject - - The title (subject) of the e-mail.
        text - - The e-mail content.
        Returns:
        - Returns 0 if an e-mail was sent successfully, 1 if there was an authentication error or some other error when creating the e-mail.

      • send

        public static int send(java.lang.String from,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       java.lang.String to,
                       java.lang.String subject,
                       java.lang.String text)
        Sends an e-mail through Gmail's SMTP server. The sender needs to allow less secure apps to access their account.
        Parameters:
        from - - E-mail address of the sender.
        password - - E-mail password of the sender.
        to - - E-mail address of recipient.
        subject - - The title (subject) of the e-mail.
        text - - The e-mail content.
        Returns:
        - Returns 0 if an e-mail was sent successfully, 1 if there was an authentication error or some other error when creating the e-mail.
